title: Neoconnery (Democrat edition)
author: VD
content_html:
Steve Sailer observes the same movement of the neocons back to their natural home that I have noticed:

If Obama makes Summers his second pick, after Rahm Emmanuel, that’s basically a message that the neos (neoliberals and neocons) are in the house and they ain’t going anywhere.

One of the main areas that Obama’s supporters are going to get the Bush treatment is with the wars. I see no sign that Obama is going to depart from the Bush administration’s aggressive foreign policy; he may not put it on steroids like McCain would have, but he’s unlikely to withdraw troops from anywhere unless it’s to send them to Pakistan, Kenya, or the Congo.

Steve Sailer observes the same movement of the neocons
back to their natural home
that I have noticed:
If Obama makes Summers his second pick, after Rahm Emmanuel, that’s basically a message that the neos (neoliberals and neocons) are in the house and they ain’t going anywhere.
One of the main areas that Obama’s supporters are going to get the Bush treatment is with the wars.  I see no sign that Obama is going to depart from the Bush administration’s aggressive foreign policy; he may not put it on steroids like McCain would have, but he’s unlikely to withdraw troops from anywhere unless it’s to send them to Pakistan, Kenya, or the Congo.
